Plotting of data/analysis¶

packerlabimaging provides a number of convenience plotting functions to create the most commonly made plots for 2photon imaging analysis.

All of these pre-built plots are demo’ed at Tutorial - making plots.

Available plotting functions:¶

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.plotRoiLocations(trialobj: packerlabimaging.TwoPhotonImagingMain.TwoPhotonImagingTrial, suite2p_rois: Union[list, str] = 'all', background: numpy.ndarray = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

plots an image of the FOV to show the locations of cells given in cells ls.

Parameters

  • trialobj – alloptical or 2p imaging object

  • background – either 2dim numpy array to use as the backsplash or None (default; which is a black background)

  • suite2p_rois – list of ROIs (suite2p cell IDs) to show coord location, default is ‘all’ (which is all ROIs)

  • edgecolor – specify edgecolor of the scatter plot for cells

  • facecolor – specify facecolor of the scatter plot for cells

  • cells – list of cells to plot

  • title – title for plot

  • color_float_list – if given, it will be used to color the cells according a colormap

  • cmap – cmap to be used in conjuction with the color_float_array argument

  • show_s2p_targets – if True, then will prioritize coloring of cell points based on whether they were photostim targets

  • invert_y – if True, invert the reverse the direction of the y axis

  • fig – a matplotlib.Figure instance, if provided use this fig for plotting

  • ax – a matplotlib.Axes.axes instance, if provided use this ax for plotting

  • show – if False, do not display plot (used when the necessity is to return the fig and ax objects to futher manipulation)

Returns fig, ax

returns fig and ax object, if show is False

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.makeSuite2pPlots(obj: Union[packerlabimaging.ExperimentMain.Experiment, packerlabimaging.TwoPhotonImagingMain.TwoPhotonImagingTrial], **kwargs)[source]¶

Makes four plots that are created by Suite2p output.

credit: run_s2p tutorial on Mouseland/Suite2p on github

Parameters

  • obj – Experiment or Trial object to use for creating Suite2p plots.

  • axs – a matplotlib.Axes.axes instance (4 cols x 1 rows), if provided use these axes for plotting

  • show – if False, do not display plot (used when the necessity is to return the fig and ax objects to futher manipulation)

Returns fig, axs

returns fig and ax object, if show is False

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.plot_flu_trace(trialobj: packerlabimaging.TwoPhotonImagingMain.TwoPhotonImagingTrial, cell, to_plot='raw', **kwargs)[source]¶

plot individual cell’s flu or dFF trace, with photostim. timings for that cell

Parameters

  • trialobj – trialobject to plot

  • cell –

  • to_plot –

  • fig – a matplotlib.Figure instance, if provided use this fig for plotting

  • ax – a matplotlib.Axes.axes instance, if provided use this ax for plotting

  • show – if False, do not display plot (used when the necessity is to return the fig and ax objects to futher manipulation)

Returns fig, ax

returns fig and ax object, if show is False

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.plot__paq_channel(paqData: packerlabimaging.processing.paq.PaqData, channel: str, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the stored signal from the specified channel from a PaqData submodule.

Parameters

  • paqData – .Paq submodule data

  • channel –

  • kwargs – x_axis: str, x axis label, if ‘time’ or “Time” found in x_axis label, will convert x axis to time domain. x_tick_secs: int, interval to plot x axis ticks ax: matplotlib axis object to use for plotting.

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.plotMeanFovFluTrace(trialobj: packerlabimaging.TwoPhotonImagingMain.TwoPhotonImagingTrial, **kwargs)[source]¶

make plot of mean Ca trace averaged over the whole FOV

Parameters

  • fig – a matplotlib.Figure instance, if provided use this fig for plotting

  • ax – a matplotlib.Axes.axes instance, if provided use this ax for plotting

  • show – if False, do not display plot (used when the necessity is to return the fig and ax objects to futher manipulation)

Returns fig, ax

returns fig and ax object, if show is False

  • y_min –

  • x_label –

  • save_fig –

  • fig – a matplotlib.Figure instance, if provided use this fig for plotting

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.plot_photostim_traces(array, trialobj: packerlabimaging.AllOpticalMain.AllOpticalTrial, title='', y_min=None, y_max=None, x_label=None, y_label=None, save_fig=None, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters

  • array –

  • trialobj –

  • title –

  • y_min –

  • y_max –

  • x_label –

  • y_label –

  • save_fig –

  • kwargs –

    options include:

    hits: ls; a ls of 1s and 0s that is used to add a scatter point to the plot at stim_start_frames indexes at 1s

Returns

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.plot_periphotostim_avg(arr: numpy.ndarray, trialobj: packerlabimaging.AllOpticalMain.AllOpticalTrial, pre_stim_sec=1.0, post_stim_sec=3.0, title='', avg_only: bool = False, x_label=None, y_label=None, pad=20, **kwargs)[source]¶

plot trace across all stims :param arr: Flu traces to plot (will be plotted as individual traces unless avg_only is True) dimensions should be cells x stims x frames :param trialobj: instance object of AllOpticalTrial :param pre_stim_sec: seconds of array to plot for pre-stim period :param post_stim_sec: seconds of array to plot for post-stim period :param title: title to use for plot :param avg_only: if True, only plot the mean trace calculated from the traces provided in arr :param x_label: x axis label :param y_label: y axis label :param kwargs:

options include:

‘stim_duration’: photostimulation duration in secs ‘y_lims’: tuple, y min and max of the plot ‘edgecolor’: str, edgecolor of the individual traces behind the mean trace ‘savepath’: str, path to save plot to

Parameters

  • fig – a matplotlib.Figure instance, if provided use this fig for plotting

  • ax – a matplotlib.Axes.axes instance, if provided use this ax for plotting

  • show – if False, do not display plot (used when the necessity is to return the fig and ax objects to futher manipulation)

Returns fig, ax

returns fig and ax object, if show is False

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.plot_SLMtargets_Locs(trialobj: packerlabimaging.AllOpticalMain.AllOpticalTrial, targets_coords: Union[list, str] = 'all', background: numpy.ndarray = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

  • targets_coords – ls containing (x,y) coordinates of targets to plot

  • background –

  • kwargs –

  • fig – a matplotlib.Figure instance, if provided use this fig for plotting

  • ax – a matplotlib.Axes.axes instance, if provided use this ax for plotting

  • show – if False, do not display plot (used when the necessity is to return the fig and ax objects to futher manipulation)

Returns fig, ax

returns fig and ax object, if show is False

packerlabimaging.plotting.plotting.plot_s2pMasks()[source]¶

Creates some images of SLM targets to suite2p.

All plotting functions:¶

  1. plot_SLMtargets_Locs()

  2. plot_cells_loc()

  3. s2pRoiImage()

  4. plot_flu_trace()

  5. plotMeanRawFluTrace()

  6. plot_s2p_raw()

  7. plotLfpSignal()

  8. plot_SLMtargets_Locs()

  9. plot_photostim_traces()

  10. plot_photostim_traces_overlap()

  11. plot_periphotostim_avg2()

  12. plot_periphotostim_avg()
